name: Welch and Dickey Mountain

trails_config.name: Welch & Dickey Loop
trails_config.description: Famous for expansive granite slabs and continuous views. One of the earliest trails to dry in the spring and a top destination for fall foliage.
trails_config.parking_info: Welch & Dickey Trailhead, Upper Mad River Rd, Thornton, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 2734 feet, Welch and Dickey Mountain offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 2734 feet, Welch and Dickey Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Welch & Dickey Loop**, a **4.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Tecumseh**, which is just 3.4 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
